intro: Spermacoce brachystema var. micrantha, commonly known as the small-fruited starlingweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
